12:35.race_name: BOYLE Sports Home Of Early Payout Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Qualifier) (GBB) (Div I)

runners.comment: Unbeaten prior to a Listed blip last time; clear pick on the figures back down in class
runners.name: Sober Glory
runners.spotlight: Listed winner at Newbury in final bumper start; disappointing favourite returned to that grade at Sandown (second hurdles attempt) most recently, losing his unbeaten status, but can be given a chance to rebound from that sole blip on an otherwise progressive record; clear pick on the figures back down in class.

runners.comment: Modest fifth in Exeter maiden hurdle
runners.name: Colby Mayfield
runners.spotlight: Shaped with some promise but ended up a modest fifth in maiden hurdle at Exeter (2m, heavy); needs to improve sharply on the bare form.

runners.comment: Solid promise with his third-place finishes; nicely bred and still open to improvement
runners.name: Dutch Corner
runners.spotlight: Has shown solid promise with third-place finishes in Warwick bumper and Lingfield novice hurdle, both over 2m; nicely bred, represents major yard and remains open to improvement; one of the main players.

runners.comment: Took his Flat record to 3-14 with success on last appearance; new stable
runners.name: Into Battle
runners.spotlight: Took his Flat record to 3-14 with 1m2f success (RPR 82) on last appearance; sold out of Ed Walker's stable for 50,000gns later in October; market may give further guidance switched to this code.

runners.comment: Hurdles debutant whose best bumper form gives him place possibilities
runners.name: Its Top
runners.spotlight: Gained his bumper wins (point/rules) on good to soft; heavy ground provides an excuse for final effort in that sphere; had wind surgery since; best form gives him place possibilities on hurdles debut.

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Haras De La Rousseliere
runners.comment: Modest fifth over C&D last time; needs improvement
runners.name: Lheur De Gloire
runners.spotlight: Only a modest fifth over C&D last time and needs improvement to take a bigger hand; gives the impression he'll be more interesting in handicaps shortly.

runners.comment: Has shown promise in bumpers; first foal of a winning hurdler; open to progress
runners.name: Mescalero
runners.spotlight: Bumper form comprises two solid efforts on good ground at Worcester and a lesser performance on soft at Plumpton; first foal of a winning hurdler and looks open to progress in this sphere; tongue-tie fitted.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Mondant & J Le Roux
runners.comment: Fifth over C&D on reappearance; set for a similar position unless he improves
runners.name: Spanish Dancer
runners.spotlight: Fourth to useful prospect in one of his bumper starts and again showed some promise when fifth over C&D on hurdles/seasonal debut; probably set for a similar position unless he shows progress, however.

runners.comment: Two hurdles efforts suggest handicaps will be his ideal scene
runners.name: Urban Isle
runners.spotlight: Placed in final bumper attempt; modest record otherwise and two hurdles efforts (80-1 both times) suggest handicaps will be his ideal scene.

runners.comment: One of several runners who are likely to find handicaps more suitable
runners.name: Harleys Pride
runners.spotlight: Couple of heavy defeats (at about 2m4f) since switched to hurdles; one of several runners who are likely to find handicaps more suitable.

runners.comment: Trio of fourth-place finishes, latest switched to hurdles; frame possibilities
runners.name: Yeld To Call
runners.spotlight: Trio of fourth-place finishes reflect a consistent start to her career; had wind surgery since fading late over 2m3f at Warwick switched to hurdles last time; again has frame possibilities.

13:05.race_name: BOYLE Sports Home Of Early Payout Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Qualifier) (GBB) ((Div II)

runners.comment: Building up a solid record; should run his race but needs progress to defy a penalty
runners.name: North Of Richmond
runners.spotlight: Building up a solid record, latterly switched to hurdles with a win at Fakenham and creditable effort under a penalty at Leicester; should run his race but likely needs progress to defy a penalty.

runners.comment: Needs improvement to take a serious hand
runners.name: Bamber
runners.spotlight: Finished sixth to notable rival in one of his bumper starts and filled same position at Huntingdon on the switch to hurdles; set for similar outcome unless he shows improvement, however.

runners.comment: Consistent; placed in three attempts over hurdles, clear second at Wincanton latest
runners.name: Bespoke Tailor
runners.spotlight: Consistent record includes a bumper success on final outing for previous yard; placed in three maiden hurdles since, clear second at Wincanton (1m7f) most recently; holds solid and leading claims.

runners.comment: Has weak claims on form and a question mark over his jumping
runners.name: Bushstreet Bowman
runners.owner: Ben Pauling Racing & Dr Suzannah Turk
runners.spotlight: Has weak claims on form and a question mark over his jumping; others preferred.

runners.comment: Flat winner and solid second over hurdles in France; sold for 340,000euros since
runners.name: Fire Warning
runners.spotlight: Showed solid promise in the last two of his three French starts, winning on the Flat (2m1f) then close second to useful sort in Auteuil hurdle (2m2f); sold for 340,000euros since; interesting recruit.

runners.comment: Plenty to find on form
runners.name: Gulf Coast Highway
runners.spotlight: Plenty to find on the form he's shown in bumper (sole Irish start) and C&D hurdle (finished last); hood fitted.

runners.comment: Beaten long way in Fontwell maiden hurdle
runners.name: Jacquetta
runners.spotlight: Beaten long way in Fontwell maiden hurdle (2m1f) in the autumn; best watched.

runners.comment: Some promise in France, last time over hurdles; sold for 70,000euros since
runners.name: Lejo Du Seuil
runners.spotlight: Well behind Fire Warning in one of his French starts but that is flanked by encouraging placed efforts, latest at Fontainebleau (2m2f) switched to hurdles; sold for 70,000euros since; heed the market signals.

runners.comment: Has achieved little under rules
runners.name: Painted Wolf
runners.spotlight: Irish point success in 2023; has achieved little in maiden hurdles since returning from long absence.

runners.comment: Poor claims on form
runners.name: Mcflo
runners.spotlight: Thrice-raced mare who recorded a meagre RPR switched to hurdles when last seen; opposed.

runners.comment: Listed winner on Flat for Ralph Beckett; sold for 45,000gns since last run
runners.name: Square dAlboni
runners.spotlight: Trained on Flat by Ralph Beckett, posting a record of 3-4 (including Listed win) as a 2yo but 0-5 last year; sold for 45,000gns since last run; best form suggests he could make into a useful hurdler.

13:35.race_name: BOYLE Sports Best Odds Guaranteed EBF Junior "National Hunt" Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Scored comfortably at Taunton, building on his solid debut effort; respected
runners.name: Apollon Forlonge
runners.spotlight: Scored comfortably on good ground at Taunton, building on his solid debut effort behind a subsequent Grade 2 winner; respected under 7lb penalty with further progress on the cards.

runners.comment: Brings the worst form
runners.name: Callero
runners.spotlight: Brings the worst form; easily opposed.

runners.comment: 1,400gns 3yo; half-brother to a smart jumps winner; market informative
runners.name: Da Little Lion Man
runners.spotlight: 4,000euros foal, 1,400gns 3yo; half-brother to smart 2m-2m2f jumps winner Duke Of Navan; sole newcomer in the field; market instructive.

runners.comment: Promising second at Auteuil in sole French start; interesting contender
runners.name: Feel Gut
runners.spotlight: Promising second, keeping on behind the ready winner, over hurdles at Auteuil (2m2f) in sole French start; seems sure to win races for his notable new connections; interesting contender.

runners.comment: Solid third at Chepstow, then mid-race faller at Cheltenham; place claims
runners.name: Matiwo
runners.spotlight: Showed promise with solid third at Chepstow, then took a mid-race fall in Class 2 event at Cheltenham; one of the main contenders on debut form and remains open to improvement.

runners.comment: Plenty to find on form
runners.name: Pink n Purple
runners.spotlight: Never better than midfield in Wincanton bumper, then soundly beaten over hurdles at Lingfield; plenty to find.

runners.comment: Shaped with some promise prior to weakening at Wincanton
runners.name: Sixtys Rock
runners.spotlight: Related to a couple of winners for his connections; last of five finishers at Wincanton but shaped with some promise prior to weakening; may improve with the outing under his belt.

runners.comment: Had wind surgery since folding tamely in autumn bumper
runners.name: Clear Sky
runners.spotlight: Had wind surgery since folding tamely in autumn bumper at Stratford; may see her race out better and show improvement; bred for jumps.

runners.comment: Both starts in bumpers; midfield at Newbury latest
runners.name: Lets Go Mo
runners.spotlight: Both starts in bumpers, better effort when midfield at Newbury latest; likely set for a similar position unless she improves for hurdles.

runners.comment: Weak claims on form
runners.name: Mya Du Clos
runners.spotlight: Holds weak claims on her two efforts (bumper/hurdle).

14:05.race_name: DJB Cleaning Handicap Chase (For The Harwell Trophy) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Wins at Hereford on his last two starts; this unexposed 6yo may take latest rise in stride
runners.name: Buckna
runners.spotlight: Won at Hereford (3m1f, good) in November on second chase start and comfortably followed up there last month (3m1f, good to soft); in a deeper race today but this unexposed 6yo may be able to take latest 7lb rise in his stride.

runners.comment: Modest strike-rate but runner-up in this visor on last two outings; could be bang there
runners.name: Muskoka
runners.spotlight: Just one win from his 16 starts but he's consistent and has been runner-up in this visor on his last two outings (3m, good/good to soft); there's every chance he'll be bang there.

runners.comment: 1l behind when falling at final fence at Doncaster; looks well treated now only 3lb higher
runners.name: Top Target
runners.spotlight: Promising third on chase debut at Wetherby (2m3f, good) in November and he was 1l behind the leader and clear of the rest when falling at the final fence at Doncaster (3m, good to soft) last month; the winner has followed up and this fellow looks well treated now only 3lb higher.

runners.comment: Kept on for close 2nd over 2m4f here latest; the step up in trip could be a positive move
runners.name: Aviation
runners.spotlight: 2m4f novice hurdle winner (good) who kept on well for a close second here (2m4f, good to soft) four weeks ago on his second chase start; the step up in trip could be a positive move and he's one to consider.

runners.comment: Just 1lb above his last winning mark but below best on both outings this season
runners.name: Awaythelad
runners.spotlight: He's just 1lb higher than when winning at Southwell (3m, good to soft) last March; Ascot in November was a step back in the right direction but he was still below his best and this 9yo needs to raise his game today.

runners.comment: Encouraging 2nd on chase debut; soundly beaten next time; has had a second wind op since
runners.name: Gold In The Rivers
runners.spotlight: Encouraging second of eight on chase debut at Lingfield (2m4f, good) in November; however, soundly beaten at Lingfield (2m4f, good) 16 days later and has to bounce back in new headgear, following a second wind op.

runners.comment: 10yo who is inconsistent but ran well for a long way last time and is on a dangerous mark
runners.name: Sheldon
runners.spotlight: 10yo who is inconsistent and his jumping can be an issue; however, he ran a big race for a long way in very testing conditions at Exeter four weeks ago and he's not discounted off a dangerous mark.

runners.comment: Interesting contender now up in trip and back in a handicap on second chase start
runners.name: Taita Hills
runners.spotlight: 3m point (good) and 2m4f handicap hurdle (soft) winner who made a satisfactory chase debut at Lingfield (2m, good to soft) last month when facing a tough task at the weights in that three-runner beginners' contest; interesting contender now up in trip and back in a handicap.

runners.breeder: Mrs Larissa Kneip & Mrs Sandrine Grevet
runners.comment: Back on song when clear second to unexposed winner at Hereford last month; chance
runners.name: Captain Boudet
runners.spotlight: Two wins early last year (2m5f/2m3f, soft/good) from first three chase starts and he was back on song when second of six at Hereford (3m1f, good to soft) last month, when clear with an unexposed winner; chance.

runners.comment: Two chase wins but remains 6lb above last winning mark and returns from some time off
runners.name: Always Busy
runners.spotlight: Two chase wins (3m1f/3m, good to soft/good), the latest in a small field last May; however, he needs to prove this 6lb higher mark isn't beyond him; absent since falling at Worcester in July.

runners.comment: Below par latest but runner-up twice in a row previously; each-way claims if bouncing back
runners.name: Mahler Moon
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles here (3m, good to soft) last March and runner-up twice in a row in November (2m5f/3m1f, good) when back over fences; below par last time (3m1f, good to soft) but each-way claims if bouncing back.

runners.comment: Still early days and well backed last time, but has been well beaten on both chase starts
runners.name: Rule Me In
runners.spotlight: 3m point runner-up who won 2m maiden hurdle at Southwell last February; still early days over fences and backed into favouritism at Windsor last time, but he's now been soundly beaten in both chases; has to raise his game.

14:40.race_name: Wendigo Wins The Brown Advisory Handicap Hurdle

runners.breeder: M G Cousin M P Havard Mme J Cousin
runners.comment: Emphatic win at Market Rasen took his record since handicapping to 3-3; greatly respected
runners.name: CEst Different
runners.spotlight: Strode clear for emphatic success in Pertemps qualifier at Market Rasen (2m7f, good to soft) in sole start this term, taking record since handicapping to 3-3; another big hike in the weights reflects his progress, which may well continue; greatly respected back down in grade.

runners.comment: Still lightly raced and this is a drop back in class, so may prove resurgent
runners.name: Kayf Dancer
runners.spotlight: Gained his Exeter success last spring in a weak maiden; has regressed in two handicaps this season; however, still lightly raced and this is a drop back in class, so may prove resurgent.

runners.comment: Won at Southwell on last hurdles attempt; revival possible returned to this sphere
runners.name: High Treason
runners.spotlight: Modest efforts this term, taking chase record to 0-6; rallied to win at Southwell (2m4f) on last hurdles attempt, taking strike-rate in this sphere to 2-5; revival possible, provided he takes well to added visor.

runners.comment: Well treated on Eider win but nowhere near that form since returned to hurdles
runners.name: Knockanore
runners.spotlight: Well treated on his Eider Chase win (off 1lb higher) last February but has totally failed to transfer the form back to hurdles in last two outings; something to prove.

runners.comment: Scored at Haydock last time; holding his form well and is better than ever
runners.name: Kiss My Face
runners.spotlight: Hurdles record of 5-32 includes wins over 3m on good ground at Wetherby in October and Haydock latest start; holding his form well and is better than ever; may remain competitive.

runners.comment: May still have more to offer but this new trip presents a question mark
runners.name: Ocean Conquest
runners.spotlight: Commenced his current campaign with good-ground wins at Ludlow (2m/2m5f); flopped on soft at Sandown (2m) since; may still have more to offer but this new trip presents a question mark.

runners.comment: Something to prove, having gained both hurdles wins over 2m5f at Warwick
runners.name: Crazierthandaisy
runners.spotlight: Folded tamely at Sandown last time; this Henderson runner is not totally written off but she has something to prove in this scenario, having gained both hurdles wins over 2m5f at Warwick against her own sex.

runners.comment: Won at Lingfield last time and remains unexposed at this sort of distance; shortlisted
runners.name: Block Rockin Beats
runners.spotlight: Opened his hurdles account in similar event at Lingfield (2m7f, soft) last time; remains unexposed at this sort of distance and bumper form suggests he has the potential to do better still; shortlisted.

runners.comment: Consistent until taking backward steps on RPRs the last twice
runners.name: Twist Of Fatecatch
runners.spotlight: Successful in maiden last spring then proved consistent in handicaps until taking backward steps on RPRs the last twice; capable of being involved off current mark, provided he rebounds.

runners.comment: Dropped away on stable/seasonal debut, perhaps needing the run
runners.name: Kintail
runners.spotlight: Proved unable to sustain early progress for previous yard but ran creditably over C&D last spring; dropped away on stable/seasonal debut, perhaps needing the run; check the market signals.

runners.comment: Only 1-16 over hurdles and is more exposed than some of these rivals
runners.name: Spitalfield
runners.spotlight: Consistent in 2025 and was still to be asked a question when falling two out at Sedgefield (3m3f) on last appearance; only 1-16 over hurdles, however, and is more exposed than some of these rivals.

runners.comment: Recorded his peak performance in sole attempt at Newbury; could go well
runners.name: De Kingpin
runners.spotlight: Reverts to hurdles with cheekpieces refitted after looking quirky over fences last time; recorded his peak performance (second past the post, promoted to first) in sole attempt at Newbury; could go well.

runners.comment: Ran creditably last time but this looks a tougher assignment
runners.name: Faded Fantasy
runners.spotlight: Ran creditably at Hereford (3m1f) last time, bouncing back from two poor efforts, but this looks a tougher assignment; still seeking first handicap success above Class 5.

runners.comment: Not disgraced last time but this is a stronger contest
runners.name: Island Run
runners.spotlight: Gained his only wins at Wincanton in 2022 and 2023; not disgraced when runner-up in Class 5 at Lingfield (2m7f) most recently but looks unlikely to go one better in this stronger contest.

runners.comment: Opened his rules account in Aintree event last time; unexposed at this trip; in the mix
runners.name: Top Guy
runners.spotlight: Skelton runner; opened his rules account in novice handicap at Aintree (3m, soft) last time, building on his good second at Southwell (2m4f); unexposed at this trip and looks the type to improve further; in the mix.

runners.comment: Moving in the right direction (form figures 4331) in handicaps; may improve further
runners.name: On The Go
runners.spotlight: Moving in the right direction (form figures 4331, all off 10lb lower) in handicaps, drawing clear for 10l success at Hereford (2m5f) most recently; has to deal with new mark but may continue to show progress.

runners.comment: Needs to raise her game in this deeper field
runners.name: Jolie Baie
runners.spotlight: Scored twice last term but has proved unable to finish so strongly in two outings this season, losing second on the run-in at Uttoxeter latest; needs to raise her game in this deeper field.

15:15.race_name: Alder Demain & Akers Mares' Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Better than ever with wins in major handicaps at Cheltenham and Newbury this season
runners.name: Panic Attack
runners.spotlight: Better than ever with wins in major handicaps at Cheltenham (2m4f, soft) and Newbury (3m2f, good to soft) this season, taking record for current yard to 3-6; two from two in Listed grade; well clear on ratings, even with a 4lb penalty, returned to this level.

runners.comment: Exposed sort but best form suggests she can achieve a top-three finish in this field
runners.name: Ilovethenightlife
runners.spotlight: Record of only 1-10 over fences and rather exposed; distant second on penultimate start and never landed a blow in competitive handicap at Cheltenham latest; however, best form suggests she can achieve a top-three finish in this field.

runners.comment: Limitations exposed in Listed chases the last twice; opposed
runners.name: Mini Mildred
runners.spotlight: Completed her five-timer (Flat/hurdles) at a modest level on the mainland and in Jersey; limitations exposed in a couple of Listed chases since, finishing last of five latest; similar outcome is on the cards.

runners.breeder: H Fowler A Frost & C Longsdon
runners.comment: Progressive this term, winning twice over fences then good second in Listed hurdle
runners.name: Molto Bene
runners.owner: Hot To Trot Jumping And Ffl Bloodstock
runners.spotlight: Two from two over fences, namely handicap wins at Bangor (2m4f, good) and Huntingdon (2m7f, good to soft) in the autumn; good second in Listed hurdle at Doncaster (3m) since; interesting contender, with further improvement plausible returned to chasing.

runners.comment: Comfortably held by Molto Bene on latest effort and faces a stiff task
runners.name: Presenting A Queen
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdles winner; has some place form over fences but finished 10l behind Molto Bene at Huntingdon last time and is worse off with that rival at level weights upped up class; stiff assignment.

15:50.race_name: BOYLE Sports Daily Money Back Meetings Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Qualifier)

runners.comment: Arrives in pretty good heart but this 10yo may be vulnerable against progressive types
runners.name: Parramount
runners.spotlight: Runner-up at Doncaster (2m, soft) in November when back over hurdles and ran pretty well when sixth of 15 at Ascot (1m7f, soft) last month; has won on good ground; however, this 10yo takes on some progressive rivals this afternoon and may again be vulnerable.

runners.breeder: E A R L Arnaud Vasselin
runners.comment: Well handicapped on form as recent as last March but arrives with something to prove
runners.name: Tintintin
runners.spotlight: Close fourth of 17 at in the Imperial Cup at Sandown (2m, good to soft) last March and now 5lb lower; it was his chase debut when pulled up at Lingfield in November but he nevertheless arrives with something to prove regarding his current form; wears first-time cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Third at Wincanton on handicap debut then didn't see out 2m4f here; not ruled out
runners.name: Doctors Hill
runners.spotlight: Won novice hurdle at Chepstow (2m, soft) in November and ran well when third on handicap debut at Wincanton (1m7f, good to soft) next time; didn't see out 2m4f here subsequently and not ruled out now back down in trip.

runners.comment: Readily made all in Plumpton novice and he brings potential to this handicap debut
runners.name: General Briar
runners.spotlight: Point and bumper runner-up who readily made all at Plumpton (2m, soft) in December on third hurdle start; had previously shown promise on good ground; brings potential to his handicap debut and could go well.

runners.comment: Close second in Leicester novice in November and looks to have workable opening mark
runners.name: Sir Hobnob
runners.spotlight: Good-ground bumper winner who was a close second at Leicester (1m7f, soft) in November on his third hurdle start; the winner followed up in a handicap, indicating this unexposed 5yo has a workable opening mark.

runners.comment: Good form on AW in autumn; two lesser runs followed; others have fewer questions to answer
runners.name: Gifted Angel
runners.spotlight: Won three juvenile hurdles in 2023; returned from absence to finish second twice in a row on AW in autumn 2025 but two lesser runs have followed in that sphere; struggled on last two hurdle starts in early 2024; others have fewer questions to answer.

runners.comment: Progressive over hurdles earlier last year and there could still be mileage in his mark
runners.name: Almuhit
runners.spotlight: Progressive over hurdles earlier last year and two wins on the Flat in the summer; off since below-par run in the Cesarewitch trial in September but attractively handicapped in this code in view of his Flat exploits; player.

runners.comment: Won at Sedgefield on third start; a work in progress but in top hands; high on the list
runners.name: Leaumec De Mee
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on first two starts (2m/2m1f, good/good to soft) before winning maiden hurdle at Sedgefield (2m1f, soft) last month; a work in progress but is in top hands and could play a leading role on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Did it very cosily at Uttoxeter; an 11lb rise may not stop him in his hat-trick bid
runners.name: Soldiers Leap
runners.spotlight: Built upon last season's handicap promise to win on reappearance at Stratford (2m2f, good to soft) in October and he improved again to follow up at Uttoxeter (2m, soft); he did it very cosily in a first-time hood (retained) on that latest start and an 11lb rise may not stop him here.

runners.comment: Some solid form at the end of last year; further improvement is possible but necessary
runners.name: Uhtred Ragnarson
runners.spotlight: Won at Warwick (2m, good) in November on second handicap start, following a break; 2l third of six at Market Rasen (2m, good to soft) since; further improvement is possible from this 5yo but it's necessary today.

runners.breeder: Belmont B/S Glenville B/S & Conor Ryan
runners.comment: Won in good style at Hereford last March but he's failed to shine in his two handicaps
runners.name: Lions Peak
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden hurdle in good style at Hereford (2m3f, good) last March; it's too soon to write off this lightly raced 6yo but he's failed to shine in his two handicaps and needs to get back on track.

runners.comment: Won at Taunton on second handicap start; tougher task today but this 4yo looks progressive
runners.name: Premier
runners.spotlight: Flat winner who got off the mark over hurdles at the fourth attempt in a 13-runner handicap at Taunton (2m, good) last month; he's 8lb higher in a stronger race today but this 4yo has looked progressive in this code.

11:55.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Handicap

runners.comment: Progressive at 5f and outstayed over 6f latest; not yet fully exposed
runners.name: Rosieisme Darling
runners.spotlight: Progressive at a low level since handicapping, getting off the mark at Chelmsford last month; step up to 6f didn't benefit her at Southwell on New Year's Day but she can't be discounted back at 5f; ridden today by a 7lb claimer who has made a flying start to his career.

runners.comment: Poor form in handicaps, most recently at Kempton last week; opposable
runners.name: Grand Echo
runners.spotlight: Yet to show much in handicaps, the latest last week at Kempton when last of 11 (6f; cheekpieces first time); drops back to 5f for the first time since his debut; opposable.

runners.comment: Return to handicap company in her favour; bold bid expected but vulnerable late on
runners.name: Havin A Flyer
runners.spotlight: Had a lot of racing as a 2yo and failed to win in her 15 attempts; has faced a lot of stiff assignments though and her record in handicaps is actually a solid one; should make a bold bid but might find a few of these seeing it out that bit stronger.

runners.comment: Hopes rest on the drop back to 5f and the addition of blinkers sparking something extra
runners.name: He Bangs The Drums
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Lxii & Partner I
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in two 6f nurseries late last year; dropping to 5f can help, as may new blinkers, but improvement is essential.

runners.comment: Closely matched with Rosieisme Darling on latest Chelmsford run; should be involved again
runners.name: Kuiama
runners.spotlight: Successful at Wolverhampton last November and had an excuse when third at the same track later that month (went off too fast); under one length behind Rosieisme Darling at Chelmsford last time; well drawn to attack and likely to be involved once more.

runners.comment: Down the field on handicap/stable debut (6f) two weeks ago; unexposed but needs more
runners.name: Rogue Rebellion
runners.spotlight: No immediate improvement for handicapping after a wind op when sixth of eight at Southwell (6f) on New Year's Day; drawn widest and others bring more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Last month's handicap debut was more promising; open to improvement; betting to guide
runners.name: A Lott Of Kane
runners.spotlight: Finished last in his three runs in novice/maiden company; more encouragement when keeping on for a never-dangerous fourth at Chelmsford on last month's handicap debut (6f), a race where he still looked to be learning his job; open to improvement and he needs monitoring for market confidence.

runners.comment: Low-level form in six starts; easy to look elsewhere
runners.name: Dawn Melody
runners.spotlight: Low-level form in her six starts; this is more realistic than her latest assignment in novice company but still not easily recommended.

12:25.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Classified Stakes

runners.comment: Arrives in good form, well drawn and she is more appealing than most
runners.name: Colors Of Freedom
runners.spotlight: Multiple AW winner who comes here on the back of two runner-up finishes at Wolverhampton; had run well when a close fourth over C&D before that (wide draw) and she's a strong contender.

runners.comment: C&D winner 11 months ago; thrown in on that form; makes stable debut after 107 days off
runners.name: Commendation
runners.spotlight: Recorded an RPR of 70 when winning a C&D handicap last February on her first run for Michael Keady; little to shout about afterwards but she starts out for a new stable (same owner) off a reduced mark; drawn widest but a revival could be imminent.

runners.comment: Mixed record overall but dips his toe into 0-50 company for the first time
runners.name: Forest Gunner
runners.spotlight: 5f win at Southwell last October; mixed record since but this is his first attempt in 0-50 company and he can't be ignored; visor experiment quickly aborted.

runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate II
runners.comment: Mixed bag since a quick 5f double last August; wide trip latest; not discounted
runners.name: Global Effort
runners.spotlight: Won twice in the space of eight days last August; mixed bag since but he was caught out wide when seventh of nine at Wolverhampton 12 days ago and he should be more of a threat this time.

runners.comment: 15-race maiden who gets going too late; down in grade but others stronger for the win
runners.name: Nad Alshiba Snow
runners.spotlight: Still seeking her first win but she has run some solid races in defeat for her new yard; tends to get going too late though and this drop into 0-50 company isn't enough to earn her the verdict.

runners.comment: These conditions more suitable than some he's faced but maiden status set to remain intact
runners.name: Rogue Endeavour
runners.spotlight: 19-race maiden; out of sorts when last seen, albeit there were mitigating circumstances on his last three outings; others look safer.

runners.comment: Went close on penultimate start but failed to back it up latest; new headgear today
runners.name: Sultan Of Oj
runners.spotlight: 0-14 but he went close in a 5f handicap at Wolverhampton on his penultimate start; only sixth in a Wolverhampton classified event 12 days ago and cheekpieces are now given a go (has worn a hood and blinkers in the past).

12:55.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Low-key debut last month (7f) but this expensive yearling purchase can do better in time
runners.name: Ada Rose
runners.spotlight: Expensive yearling but she made a low-key start to her career when 13th of 14 at Southwell last month (7f); should do better at some point.

runners.comment: First foal of a well-related Listed winner; starts out at realistic level; one to consider
runners.name: Chamas
runners.spotlight: First foal of a 7f-1m2f winner (including Listed; RPR 106), herself a half-sister to two Group winners; starts out at a realistic level and she looks one to take seriously.

runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: Promise in one run in Ireland (1m, heavy); open to improvement for her new stable
runners.name: Lady Dora Mae
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise with seventh-place finish, albeit never landing a blow, in a big-field maiden at the Curragh (1m, heavy) 73 days ago; sold for 15,000gns last month; withdrawn when refusing to enter the stalls at Wolverhampton ahead of last month's intended stable debut; was only 5-2 at the time and interesting to see if her backers return.

runners.comment: Sold for 12,000gns after showing fair ability for James Ferguson; one to consider
runners.name: Loma Express
runners.spotlight: The pick of her three runs for James Ferguson came when second at Newcastle last October (7f); only four ran there though and she wasn't at the same level when last seen 53 days ago; changed hands for 12,000gns last month; one to consider.

runners.comment: Weakened in the final furlong on Kempton debut (7f; steadily run); can do better
runners.name: Lotus
runners.spotlight: Weakened in the final furlong in a steadily-run 7f fillies' novice at Kempton last month; should leave that effort behind in time and she doesn't have much to find on RPR.

runners.comment: Over 3l to find with Lotus on latest run and others bring more pressing claims
runners.name: Stole My Heart
runners.spotlight: She finished a modest sixth in her two runs in late 2025, including when 3.5l behind Lotus at Kempton five weeks ago; improvement needed.

runners.comment: Down the field at Newmarket on debut 145 days ago (hung badly left); bred to do better
runners.name: Ventana
runners.spotlight: 40-1 for her Newmarket debut last August, a race where she hung badly left when coming under pressure; bred to do much better at some point.

13:25.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: Heavily backed when winning over 7f here last week; solid claims under a penalty
runners.name: Giles Glory
runners.spotlight: Asserted late on in a 7f handicap here last week, rewarding strong market support in the process (new accessories and first run after a gelding operation); 1m should be in range on that evidence and he holds strong claims despite a 6lb penalty.

runners.comment: Improved effort when 2nd at Wolverhampton last month (8.6f; well backed); one to consider
runners.name: Chilliconcarneigh
runners.spotlight: Ran his best race so far when second of nine at Wolverhampton last month (8.6f; well backed); that form has taken some knocks since but he still commands respect at this level.

runners.comment: Modest form in four starts, including when switched to a handicap 12 days ago; not solid
runners.name: Urban Law
runners.spotlight: Modest form in maiden/novice company and she was again well held when last of eight on her handicap debut 12 days ago; dropped 4lb but needs to find extra.

runners.breeder: S A R L Haras De Dodville
runners.comment: Latest midfield finish here (7f) was better; moves into handicaps with untapped potential
runners.name: Hove Ranger
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on first two starts but his latest midfield finish here (7f) was more promising; moves into handicaps with the potential for better.

runners.comment: No improvement for the switch to handicaps when last seen in November; new trip today
runners.name: Lady Birgma
runners.spotlight: No improvement for the switch to nurseries when sixth of nine at Wolverhampton last November (7f; visored first time, absent today); steps up in trip with a point to prove.

runners.comment: Soft ground a possible excuse for latest low-key run; bred to be better than we have seen
runners.name: Karakula Dancer
runners.spotlight: Sent off a strong favourite for his nursery debut at Chelmsford last August (7f) but he could only manage fourth of the six runners; soft ground perhaps against him when last seen four months ago; bred to do better.

runners.comment: Modest form in three qualifying runs but blinkers added for handicap debut; check betting
runners.name: Ezera
runners.owner: D Macauliffe A Don & LDS Bloodstock
runners.spotlight: Down the field in three runs in maiden/novice company, including when upped to a mile at Chelmsford four weeks ago; this should be more realistic though and blinkers could give her a lift too; betting useful.

runners.comment: Poor form in five runs over shorter; hopes rest on the step up to a mile sparking extra
runners.name: Will He Shine
runners.spotlight: Poor form in five starts, including both handicap runs; hopes rest on the step up to a mile sparking improvement.

13:55.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: Second to Giles Glory (runs in division one) over 7f here last week; stamina to prove
runners.name: Athenian Spirit
runners.owner: Mpr Xxi S Marris & Rathmoy Racing Vii
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two of his three runs since cheekpieces went on, including here last week when unable to hold the late challenge of Giles Glory (runs in the 1.25); clearly handicapped to go well but his stamina for this trip has to be taken on trust.

runners.comment: Couldn't justify favouritism on handicap debut last month but still shaped OK; key player
runners.name: Hardstyle
runners.spotlight: Couldn't reward market support on his handicap debut at Wolverhampton two weeks ago (8.6f) but he left the impression he wasn't suited by the tempo of that race; remains capable of better and he is a key player.

runners.comment: 0-9 and finished behind Chinchin at Chelmsford last time; needs to raise her game
runners.name: Flying Macs
runners.spotlight: 0-9 but she has run some fair races in defeat; finished behind Chinchin at Chelmsford 12 days ago, however, and she needs to raise her game.

runners.comment: Disappointed last time but earlier Chelmsford third was encouraging; still early days
runners.name: Akrivos
runners.spotlight: Promising third on his handicap debut at Chelmsford (1m) in November but he took a backwards step at Wolverhampton last month; still has time to deliver a bigger performance.

runners.comment: Unplaced all seven starts but latest run wasn't too bad and dropped another 3lb since
runners.name: Shes Got The Blues
runners.spotlight: Yet to be placed after seven starts (two for Tony Carroll) but her latest Wolverhampton run was a bit better than the distance beaten might indicate; dropped another 3lb; each-way shout.

runners.comment: Looks exposed after eight unplaced efforts; dropping down the weights but others are safer
runners.name: Lapidarist
runners.spotlight: Looks exposed after eight unplaced efforts; dropping down the weights but others appeal more.

runners.comment: Two fair efforts in Chelmsford handicaps but she needs a career best to take this
runners.name: Chinchin
runners.spotlight: She has run two creditable races since switched to handicaps, both over a mile at Chelmsford, without looking ahead of her mark; a career best is required to win.

runners.breeder: C N Wright M Bell & A Elliott
runners.comment: Never dangerous 33-1 shot on last month's handicap debut; improvement required
runners.name: Out In The Cold
runners.spotlight: 33-1 for last month's handicap debut at Wolverhampton (8.6f), a race where she never threatened from the rear; improvement required.

14:30.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap

runners.comment: In fine form since late August but put in her place by Gogo Yubari over C&D on Saturday
runners.name: Hint Of Humour
runners.spotlight: In fine form since August, winning three times (including C&D; also first past the post in October but demoted to fourth); solid placed efforts off this mark on her last two starts but she was no match for her reopposing stablemate Gogo Yubari over C&D on Saturday; 10lb better off today but will it be sufficient?

runners.comment: Three wins in five days last week, all of them decisive; can deal with a 15lb penalty
runners.name: Gogo Yubari
runners.spotlight: Having dropped a long way in the weights she has returned to form with a vengeance of late, winning over C&D last month and completing a five-day hat-trick last week (all wins by over 2l); has to shoulder a rarely-sighted 15lb penalty but she still makes plenty of appeal in her current form.

runners.comment: Well held behind Gogo Yubari here on Saturday; 10lb better off but appears vulnerable
runners.name: Faustus
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer; nearly 7l behind Gogo Yubari here on Saturday and opposable despite the 10lb turnaround in the weights.

runners.comment: Reared as the stalls opened when last of six at Southwell yesterday; others better treated
runners.name: Beaumadier
runners.spotlight: Conditions no problem and he had been in good order prior to finishing last of six at Southwell yesterday, a race where he lost his chance when rearing as the stalls opened; others appeal as being better treated.

runners.comment: Both wins have come at 6f and she could prove vulnerable back down in trip
runners.name: Woodhay Whisper
runners.spotlight: Both her wins have come over 6f and she has been beaten off this mark on her last three starts; could prove vulnerable back at 5f.

runners.comment: Conditions to suit and on a good mark; may face pressure for the lead once again
runners.name: Micks Spirit
runners.spotlight: Multiple C&D winner who lurks on a dangerous mark; couldn't get to the front in the C&D handicap won by Gogo Yubari on Saturday and again has Faustus to contend with for the early lead.

runners.comment: Fine run of form ground to a halt at Wolverhampton 15 days ago; up in class today
runners.name: Alafdhal
runners.spotlight: Below par at Wolverhampton two weeks ago but he had been in blistering form beforehand, winning three times (including C&D); up in class today though and others are stronger.

15:05.race_name: Midnite Aint Your Grandads Bookie Handicap

runners.comment: Blown the start both runs this winter; capable at this level but he's a risky proposition
runners.name: Pride Of Nepal
runners.spotlight: Has the ability to play a major role at this level but he has fluffed the start on his two runs this winter; promising apprentice booked but hard to be confident at present.

runners.comment: Ended 2025 with a whimper but drops in grade with new accessories fitted
runners.name: Graffiti
runners.spotlight: On a reduced mark but he ended 2025 quietly; eligible for 0-55 company as a result but others look safer; tongue-tie returns today and cheekpieces make their debut.

runners.comment: Improving on AW this winter and no problem with conditions; holds strong claims
runners.name: Krissy
runners.spotlight: Thriving on AW this winter, winning handicaps at Newcastle (1m2f) and Wolverhampton (1m4f) either side of second-place finishes over C&D and at Southwell (1m3f); went through that Southwell race like one who was still ahead of her mark; strong claims.

runners.comment: 0-12 but she shaped okay on stable debut here last month; didn't build on it last week
runners.name: Pure Theory
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden; made an encouraging stable debut over C&D last month but she wasn't able to build on it at Chelmsford last week; each-way shout in an uncompetitive event.

runners.comment: Quiet year in 2025 but dropped 15lb as a result; worth a market check on his stable debut
runners.name: Chourmo
runners.spotlight: Won four times on turf in 2024 when trained by Mark Gillard; more miss than hit in 2025 but he dropped 15lb as a consequence; picked up for £4,000 last August; starts out for new yard at a modest level and he is worth a market check.

runners.comment: Two C&D wins last winter; back near his best last month and he is high on the list
runners.name: Dubai Harbour
runners.spotlight: Won twice over C&D last winter and he was back near his peak when second in a similar event last month; not quite so good over 1m4f last time but he is still more appealing than many.

runners.comment: 30-race maiden; two C&D runs last month were respectable but others have stronger claims
runners.name: Haveagobeau
runners.spotlight: Record stands at 0-30 but he has only had two runs over this trip and both have been respectable; others still bring more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Well beaten on his return from a long absence last month (1m; 150-1); hard to fancy
runners.name: Arlos Sunshine
runners.spotlight: Dropped away to finish last of ten over 1m here last month, his first outing for 429 days (150-1); best watched over this longer trip.

15:40.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Record in Class 5 handicaps (7f) of -2111112; good run at Southwell latest; solid claims
runners.name: How Impressive
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; made all at Kempton last October (7f) and after two lesser runs in Class 4 company he was back in form when second at Southwell ten days ago (set a strong pace); well drawn to attack and he should remain a force at this level.

runners.comment: Not at best so far this winter; hopes pinned on the drop in class sparking a revival
runners.name: This Farh
runners.spotlight: Not at his best in two runs this winter; now drops into Class 5 company but this C&D winner has a bit more to prove than some of his rivals.

runners.comment: 7f win at Southwell last October; solid efforts twice since; now has headgear enlisted
runners.name: Captain Parma
runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced 4yo; off the mark in a 7f handicap at Southwell last October and he has run two solid races in defeat since; back from an eight-week break with cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: His win in this race in 2025 was the 3rd leg of quick C&D hat-trick; not in same form now
runners.name: Tadreeb
runners.spotlight: He was completing a quick C&D hat-trick when landing the corresponding race 12 months ago off a 1lb higher mark; doesn't arrive in the same form this time around but a revival could be around the corner.

runners.comment: Winning stable debut over C&D last month but not in the same form at Chelmsford last time
runners.name: Me Tarzan
runners.spotlight: Two turf wins for James Fanshawe last summer and he took a step forward when winning over C&D on his stable debut last month; not so good at Chelmsford 12 days ago and another personal best will be required to take this.

runners.breeder: Ballybin Stud Ltd & Patrick F Kelly
runners.comment: May have needed the run when 5th of seven on last month's handicap debut; still unexposed
runners.name: Maximising
runners.spotlight: Perhaps needed the run, his first for 156 days, when weakening into fifth on last month's handicap debut at Southwell; still early days.

runners.comment: Has run well over C&D but all wins at 6f and he was behind two of today's rivals last time
runners.name: Havana Sky
runners.spotlight: All eight wins have been achieved over 6f but he has twice run well over this C&D; not at his best behind two of these rivals at Southwell ten days ago though.

runners.comment: Close 2nd over C&D two weeks ago but she has more to do back against male opposition
runners.name: Crystal Dagger
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in four of her seven starts, the latest a narrow defeat over C&D two weeks ago; that was comfortably her best AW run but she has more to do back agaist male opposition.

17:30.race_name: Unibet Celebrate Sponsoring 3000 Races Amateur Jockeys' Handicap

runners.comment: Disappointing favourite last week but has won two of her last four starts, including here
runners.name: Up The Anti
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent and she was a disappointing favourite over C&D last Wednesday; however, she's won two of her last four starts, the latest here (6f) last month, and she stays 7f; can have a big say if she's on a going day.

runners.comment: It's possible she's gone off the boil but the drop back down in trip could trigger revival
runners.name: Vizzavona Lady
runners.spotlight: It's possible she's gone off the boil but her last two outings have been over 8.6f/1m and her good form in the autumn came at 7f (on Tapeta; has shown promise on Polytrack); could have a part to play back down in trip.

runners.comment: Not at his best this winter but he won the last time Henry Callan was on board
runners.name: Rising Force
runners.spotlight: He hasn't been at the top of his game this winter on his first two runs for Darryll Holland; however, he won at Lingfield (1m, Polytrack) last August on his final outing for Robert Eddery (who still owns him) and Henry Callan is back on board for the first time since; possible player.

runners.comment: 0-7 but ran well when fourth at Wolverhampton last time and he's one to consider
runners.name: Knightmare
runners.spotlight: 0-7 but produced best handicap performance yet when fourth at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) last month on final run for Dylan Cunha, and the way he kept on provides optimism he'll be fine now back up to 7f; also effective on Polytrack; one to consider on stable debut following 5,500gns sale.

runners.comment: On a reduced mark but he's hard to fancy on his recent form and is unproven at this trip
runners.name: Hallowed Time
runners.spotlight: Went close at Wolverhampton last January and now 8lb lower; however, he's hard to fancy on his recent form and is unproven at this trip.

runners.comment: On a handy mark but this 10yo finished down the field on last month's stable debut
runners.name: The Cola Brasil
runners.spotlight: On a handy mark on last year's best form for Michael Bell but this 10yo finished down the field on last month's stable debut at Southwell (7f) and his losing sequence continues.

18:00.race_name: Get Daily Price Boosts At Unibet Handicap

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner; attracted support and back to form with narrow second latest; player
runners.name: Classic Speed
runners.spotlight: Two front-running C&D wins in 2024; little to enthuse over last year until a prominent market position correctly predicted a return to form when beaten a head over 7f here last month; up 3lb but still below his winning marks and looks a leading contender despite possible pace pressure.

runners.comment: C&D winner; won here (7f) last month; moderate run 12 days ago but could bounce back
runners.name: Adace
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who ended a lengthy losing run when scoring off a reduced mark here (7f) last month; up 4lb and was way below that over this trip at Chelmsford (Polytrack; 25-1) 12 days ago; bounce back required but that's not out of the question.

runners.comment: 2nd AW win when scoring (7f, Polytrack) 3 weeks ago; has form here & at 1m; key contender
runners.name: Homme De Fer
runners.spotlight: Improved since switched to AW and won his second race on the surface when scoring at Lingfield (7f, Polytrack) three weeks ago; up 3lb but has form at a mile and has also run creditably here; big player.

runners.comment: Fair fourth over C&D in November; form dipped slightly latest but he's not fully exposed
runners.name: Whiskey Sunrise
runners.spotlight: Two fair efforts over 1m since handicapping, including when fourth of ten over C&D in November; form dipped slightly at Lingfield last time but he's not fully exposed and far from ruled out.

runners.comment: C&D win after a break; returns from 92 days away and it could be the time to catch her
runners.name: Angelica K
runners.spotlight: Sole success came over C&D in February after a 144-day break; respectable fourth at Sandown (1m2f, good) in July but two poor efforts followed and she's been rested subsequently; 4lb below her winning mark and maybe this reappearance is the time to catch her.

runners.comment: 2 solid efforts before beating one home at Chelmsford 12 days ago; others more persuasive
runners.name: First Encounter
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer who won a Polytrack selling handicap at Chelmsford (1m2f) in October 2024 and also scored at Salisbury (1m) in July; two solid efforts before beating one home back at Chelmsford 12 days ago; others more persuasive.

runners.comment: 12-race maiden who was beaten 38l at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) last week; blinkers added
runners.name: Pave The Way
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden who was beaten 38l at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) last week; trainer had a 66-1 winner on that card and this one will likely be a similar price; blinkers added.

runners.comment: Poor form in three starts last year and only beat two home over C&D when last seen in May
runners.name: Cherry Hill
runners.spotlight: 7f winner here in 2023 who went close over C&D in October 2024; poor form in three starts last year and she only beat two home over C&D when last seen in May; hard to fancy on this comeback without market support.

runners.comment: Fair third over C&D in October hasn't been matched over further since
runners.name: Marchetti
runners.spotlight: 7f course winner in 2023; fair third over C&D in October hasn't been matched over further since and she suffered a seriously heavy defeat at Lingfield (1m2f) last month; drop back to this trip might help but market interest is needed to boost her claims.

runners.comment: In the doldrums last year and impossible to fancy despite a new headgear combination
runners.name: Mister Knockout
runners.spotlight: Best run came when third of 12 here (7f) in September 2024 but has been in the doldrums since signing off for Eve Johnson Houghton later that year; impossible to fancy despite a new headgear combination.

runners.comment: Not too shabby when sixth (7f, Tapeta) in November but that hasn't been built on
runners.name: Weston Court
runners.spotlight: 0-5 on AW but didn't run badly when sixth of 12 at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) in November; hasn't built on that in two starts subsequently and finished last at Lingfield last month.

18:30.race_name: Bet £20 Get £20 With Unibet Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Three solid efforts in 1m AW maiden/novice events including over C&D; firm contender
runners.name: Jazzy Baby
runners.spotlight: Three solid efforts in 1m AW maiden/novice events, running to a similar level on each occasion including when second over C&D (80-1) in October; firm contender.

runners.comment: 50-1 & drawn widest when behind on debut here (7f) in May; kinder stall on this return
runners.name: Kamaway
runners.spotlight: 30,000gns yearling; 50-1 and drawn widest when down the field on her debut here (7f) in May; has a Group 1 winner in the family and ought to be capable of better from a kinder stall on this return.

runners.comment: Narrowly sets the standard on her fourth when last seen in May; player on this comeback
runners.name: Safe Idea
runners.spotlight: Clear signs of ability in three starts at Wolverhampton (8.6f/9.5f, Tapeta) and her fourth when last seen in May narrowly sets the standard; interesting that connections are persevering and she's a player on her comeback.

runners.comment: By Zoustar; has Group 1 winner Kinnaird in the family; market clues welcome on debut
runners.name: Whisper Of Mist
runners.spotlight: By Zoustar; first foal; dam unraced sister to winners Dark Trooper (7f/1m Listed), Fantasy Lady (1m 2yo Listed), Al Hajar (useful 7f 2yo) and Volition (7f/1m), out of unraced half-sister to 1m2f Group 1 winner Kinnaird; market clues welcome on this rather belated debut.

runners.comment: 80-1 and just a small step forward when 6th (1m, Polytrack) latest; drawn better this time
runners.name: Angry Ant
runners.spotlight: 70,000gns breeze-up 2yo; 28-1 and beat two home here (7f) last month; 80-1 and just a small step forward when sixth at Lingfield (1m, Polytrack) 12 days later; better draw this time, though, and it's still early days.

runners.comment: By St Mark's Basilica; dam Listed winner & her sister won G2 for this yard; key debutante
runners.name: Church Wedding
runners.spotlight: By St Mark's Basilica; fourth foal; closely related to winners No Retreat (UAE/Bahrain 7f; RPR 103) and Esquiline (Listed-placed 1m4f; 94), half-sister to 7f/1m winner Noche Clasica (92); dam 7.3f-1m4f winner (including 2yo/Listed; 103), sister to 1m4f Group 2 winner Manuela De Vega; the latter two made winning starts for this yard and this one is a key debutante.

runners.comment: 40-1 and missed the kick when always behind on debut here (7f) last month; drawn widest
runners.name: Darn Hot Dame
runners.spotlight: 40-1 and missed the kick when showing no immediate encouragement on her debut here (7f) last month; drawn widest.

runners.comment: 100-1 when she trailed home last here (7f) six weeks ago.
runners.name: Delevingne Dream
runners.spotlight: 100-1 when she trailed home last here (7f) six weeks ago.

runners.comment: Modest stuff in two starts (7f) so far; of more interest in handicaps; tongue-tie added
runners.name: Flyta
runners.spotlight: All of her dam's runners have scored but it's been modest stuff in two starts (7f) so far; will be of more interest in handicaps; tongue-tie added.

runners.comment: Weakening fourth both starts (7f) but it was a firm step forward last time; not discounted
runners.name: Let Her Go
runners.owner: S & B Mulryan Mrs J Magnier Shanahan Hyde
runners.spotlight: Weakening fourth on both starts (7f) but it was a firm step forward at Southwell (Tapeta) last time; pedigree suggests this trip will suit at some point and she's not discounted.

runners.comment: Nathaniel filly; dam 7f AW winner (RPR 82); market check needed on this debut
runners.name: Premier Cru
runners.spotlight: Nathaniel filly; fifth foal; half-sister to Polish 6f winner Vi Et Armis; dam 7f AW winner (RPR 82), half-sister to useful 1m4f winner Awsaal; will likely need further in time but worth a market check on this debut.

runners.comment: By Gleneagles; useful pedigree and she's respected on debut despite an unhelpful draw
runners.name: Shirakawa
runners.spotlight: Gleneagles half-sister to three winners including Shamkala (French 1m-10.5f including Group 3; RPR 111); dam 1m3f and 1m4f (Listed) winner (103), half-sister to Italian 1m4f Group 1 winner Shamdala, out of 1m4f Group 2 winner; another who will probably be going up in trip soon but that's a useful pedigree and respected on debut despite an unhelpful draw.

runners.comment: 100-1 and just a modicum of promise when fifth on debut (1m, Tapeta) a fortnight ago
runners.name: Song Of The Stars
runners.spotlight: 40,000gns yearling; 100-1 and just a modicum of promise when fifth of seven on her debut at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) a fortnight ago; should do better but the draw has not been kind.

runners.comment: Debut fifth of 13 over C&D in November looks a run she can build on; interesting
runners.name: Virtue Chastity
runners.spotlight: 16,000gns yearling; 150-1 but she made steady headway from the rear when fifth of 13 over C&D in November; that looks a run she can build on; interesting.

19:00.race_name: Unibet 3 Uniboosts A Day Fillies' Handicap

runners.comment: Two fair efforts for her new stable; drops back down in class and holds each-way claims
runners.name: Mandana
runners.spotlight: Two creditable efforts for new stable and she has dropped to a career-low mark; should run her race and holds each-way claims back down in class.

runners.comment: Ended 2025 in good form; stable going well and she is one to consider
runners.name: Liv My Life
runners.spotlight: Running well in defeat of late, most recently bumping into a heavily backed improver at Wolverhampton (8.6f) two weeks ago; stable going well and she's one to consider.

runners.comment: 0-8 and has a mixed record; starts out for her new stable with a bit to prove
runners.name: Ghaiyyath Park
runners.spotlight: 0-8 but she went close at Lingfield last month (1m2f) on her final start for James Tate; hampered in the final furlong at Wolverhampton two weeks ago and came home last of the eight runners; has left Mick Appleby (same owner) since.

runners.comment: No improvement for handicapping on recent stable debut; needs to raise her game
runners.name: Leeson Street
runners.owner: Ed Babington Eddie O Leary And Partner
runners.spotlight: No improvement for the switch to handicaps when seventh of eight at Wolverhampton 15 days ago, her first start for George Boughey; has worn cheekpieces and a tongue tie independently and now wears them together for the first time.

runners.comment: Off the mark at Brighton last summer (7f) but held twice after and absent for four months
runners.name: Berning Hot
runners.spotlight: The horse she beat at Brighton (7f, good) last summer has flourished since but her two subsequent defeats don't suggest she is especially well treated; back from a four-month break and may prove vulnerable.

runners.comment: Good second here last week (7f; clear of the third); obvious claims if stamina holds out
runners.name: Maid In Chelsea
runners.spotlight: Has to prove her stamina for 1m but she arrives on the back of a good second here last week (7f), headed late on and finishing clear of the third; runs off the same mark and commands plenty of respect.

runners.comment: Fair fourth over C&D last time when wearing cheekpieces for the first time; each-way shout
runners.name: Calaxy
runners.spotlight: Slow start to her handicap career but there has been more encouragement on her last two runs, fourth over C&D four weeks ago when wearing cheekpieces for the first time; one for the shortlist.

runners.comment: 7f turf win last May; struggled twice afterwards; back from 114 days off; opposable at 1m
runners.name: Grand Citadel
runners.spotlight: Ran out the easy winner of a 7f handicap at Leicester last May; short of that level in two runs since and now has a 114-day absence to defy; stamina for a mile still not conclusively proven.

19:30.race_name: Set Your Limits With Unibet Handicap

runners.comment: Made all in June 6f novice; tough task h'cap debut next; 1m suits on pedigree; AW debut
runners.name: Try Storm Cat
runners.spotlight: All starts at 6f; led before displaying significant ability on first two starts then made all in Pontefract novice (good to firm) in June; got overwhelmed in valuable Glorious Goodwood nursery (good to soft) the following month and subsequently gelded; goes up in trip for this return and pedigree suggests he'll be all the better for it; AW debut.

runners.comment: Best effort to win (7f, Polytrack) four weeks ago; sire makes him of interest up in trip
runners.name: Illys Roo
runners.spotlight: By Australia; Salisbury novice (good) winner who posted a personal best when landing a Chelmsford nursery (also 7f, Polytrack) four weeks ago; up 4lb but his sire can surely give him a boost over this additional furlong.

runners.comment: Didn't get the breaks but still underwhelmed on stable debut latest; new trip/h'cap debut
runners.name: Ritaal
runners.spotlight: Runner-up, beaten around 5l, in two Wolverhampton fillies' maidens (7f/6f) in November when trained by Owen Burrows; sold 28,000gns early last month before finishing tenth of 14 in 7f Southwell novice a fortnight later; didn't have a clear shot at it that day but has something to prove now, not least stamina for this trip, and her opening mark doesn't look an open goal either.

runners.breeder: Aston Mullins Stud & S Barrow Esq
runners.comment: Won Irish claimer (7f, yielding) in September; warrants respect on stable/h'cap/AW debut
runners.name: Utmost Good Faith
runners.spotlight: Progressed on first three starts, culminating with Fairyhouse claimer (7f, yielding) win in September; subsequently acquired for 21,000gns and gelded; mixed messages for this trip on pedigree but warrants respect on his stable/handicap/AW debut.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner; well beaten in 3 runs last year, including for this yard; drops in grade
runners.name: Media Shooter
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner; well beaten in three runs in 2025, including at big prices on two starts for this new yard; drops in grade and will likely rediscover his level at some point.

runners.comment: AW breakthrough over C&D at the start of last month; creditable run since; solid claims
runners.name: Buccabay
runners.spotlight: Made his AW breakthrough when scoring over C&D near the start of last month and it was a creditable effort when close fifth of 12 at Southwell (6f, Tapeta) a fortnight ago; solid claims from the same mark.

runners.comment: Big step forward for this yard when second one week ago; leading contender
runners.name: No Return
runners.spotlight: Took a big step forward on second start for this yard when 66-1 and chasing home a ready winner at Lingfield (6f, Polytrack) one week ago; made all for both wins in Ireland and there's a chance he could get on the lead this time; big player.

runners.comment: Majority of wins at 7f; not in the same form since June win and mark looks tricky
runners.name: Ultramarine
runners.spotlight: 6f winner but majority of his wins at 7f; went back-to-back at Chepstow in May/June; not in same form since and returns to AW after a break with his mark still looking tricky; drop back down in trip also a slight query.

runners.comment: Out of sorts since good second (6f, Tapeta) in April and falling mark not enough to tempt
runners.name: Al Barez
runners.spotlight: C&D winner in 2024; out of sorts since a good second at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) in April and a falling mark isn't enough to tempt.

runners.comment: 2 wins as a juvenile and beaten less than 4l all four starts for this yard; not ruled out
runners.name: Mission Command
runners.spotlight: Two wins as a juvenile for George Scott and beaten less than 4l all four starts for this yard, including when running a bit better than his finishing position suggests on AW debut 83 days ago; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Began 2025 with 3 6f AW wins; fair effort returning from break latest; can build on that
runners.name: Whenthedealinsdone
runners.spotlight: Began 2025 with three AW wins (6f, Polytrack/Tapeta) but career has been punctuated by breaks since; fair effort when sixth at Lingfield (6f, Polytrack) last month, however, and he's a candidate to build on that.

runners.comment: 1st & 2nd in two starts here; 6f August turf win but downhill since; this venue may help
runners.name: Serenity Dream
runners.spotlight: First and second in just two starts here (7f); dropped to 6f when winning at Goodwood (good) in August but it's been downhill since, including when returned to 7f at Lingfield (Polytrack) last month; return to this venue might perk him up, though.

20:30.race_name: Try Unibet's New Smartview Racecards Handicap

runners.comment: Not clear run behind Duchess last time; could reverse reverse placings; cheekpieces added
runners.name: Sisterandbrother
runners.spotlight: Sole AW win came off 7lb higher at Wolverhampton (1m4f) just under a year ago; not clear run when fifth to surprise winner Duchess at Southwell (1m3f, also Tapeta) ten days ago; 3lb pull can only help and he copes with Polytrack; first-time cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Maiden who regularly fluffs the start and hasn't fared well since returning from a layoff
runners.name: Guinness Lad
runners.spotlight: Maiden who regularly fluffs the start; good second twice in May (1m2f, good to firm) but hasn't fared nearly so well since returning from a layoff; others hold greater appeal.

runners.comment: Encouraging run on yard debut last month when back from big absence; can build on that
runners.name: High Favour
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in three 7f maidens for Jim Bolger in the summer of 2024 and subsequently gelded; picked up for 1,000gns in July and offered something to work on when fifth of eight on stable debut at Lingfield (1m4f, Polytrack) last month; that was his first start for 506 days and should be sharper this time.

runners.comment: No immediate improvement for switch to handicaps when ninth (1m3f, Tapeta) in November
runners.name: Nymphaea
runners.spotlight: No immediate improvement for the switch to handicaps when ninth of 14 at Southwell (1m3f, Tapeta) in November; unexposed and it's still early days, though.

runners.comment: Just one run last year when beaten 15l in September; hard to know what to expect this time
runners.name: Bug Boy
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner at 1m2f-1m4f, including here, but he only made the track once last year, when beaten 15l in an amateur riders' event at Bath in September; hard to know what to expect on this return from another break.

runners.comment: Made all (1m5f, turf) in September; below that after but may be freshened up by a break
runners.name: Endofastorm
runners.spotlight: Dual Tapeta winner who landed a fourth career win when making all at Bath (1m5f, good to firm) in September; didn't match that in two AW runs subsequently but may have been freshened up by a break.

runners.breeder: C & S Bloodstock Ltd & Kt Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Always behind on stable/handicap debut (1m2f, Polytrack) one month ago; up in trip
runners.name: My O My
runners.spotlight: Didn't live up to 105,000gns yearling price for Charles Hills and left that yard for 1,000gns in October; always behind on her stable/handicap debut at Lingfield (1m2f, Polytrack) one month ago; up in trip but only of interest with market support.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Logis Et Al
runners.comment: 28-1 win (1m3f, Tapeta) ten days ago; 4lb penalty and not certain to beat 3rd or 5th again
runners.name: Duchess
runners.spotlight: Doubled her tally when popping up at 28-1 at Southwell (1m3f, Tapeta; Karismatique third, Sisterandbrother fifth) ten days ago; 4lb penalty and she's not guaranteed to confirm those placings but can still make her presence felt again.

runners.comment: Maiden but shown enough to win a race; close 3rd of 4 when last seen in August; contender
runners.name: Argentum
runners.spotlight: All starts at 11.5f since handicapping; yet to score but she's shown enough to win a race and it was a close third of four when last seen at Yarmouth in August; contender if ready to go after 164-day break.

runners.comment: No progress for previous yard & was beaten 26l on her last start 225 days ago; up in trip
runners.name: Dance No More
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress for previous yard and was beaten 26l on her last start (1m2f, good to firm) 225 days ago; up in trip and needs a revival on this stable debut.

runners.comment: Back in some sort of form with classified 2nd 8 days ago; more needed back in a handicap
runners.name: Lawmans Blis
runners.spotlight: Five-time Flat winner (1m4f-1m6f, four times on Wolverhampton's Tapeta) who came back to some sort of form when dropped into a classified and second at Southwell (1m3f, Tapeta; 66-1) eight days ago; more needed back in handicap company.

runners.comment: Huge prices and no threat across both codes; may do better now handicapping; needs to
runners.name: Deferred Interest
runners.spotlight: Huge prices and no threat across both codes; may do better now handicapping but only market support would make him of interest.

runners.comment: 3rd to Duchess ten days ago; that was just second handicap & first go at this sort of trip
runners.name: Karismatique
runners.spotlight: 150,000gns foal price has proved far from a snip but he recorded his first piece of worthwhile form when 80-1 and third to Duchess at Southwell (1m3f, Tapeta; Sisterandbrother fifth) ten days ago; that was just his second handicap and first go at this sort of trip so all is apparently not lost.
